titleInfo.title: LSU History Oral History Project: Sororities at LSU
titleInfo.subTitle: Jane Porter Middleton oral history interview, 1993

name.description: Louisiana State University graduate of the class of 1941.

subject.topic: Louisiana State University and Agricultural and Mechanical College--Students.
Chi Omega Fraternity.--Phi Gamma Chapter (Louisiana State University)

mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries Special Collections (http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special)
mods.accessCondition: Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright is retained by the interviewee and her heirs and Louisiana State University in accordance with U.S. copyright laws.

"E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments. See instructions for ordering reprints of this audio here: http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special/services/duplication.html Mention the ""Item number"" or ""Item URL"" in your request. "
mods.abstract: In the interview, Middleton describes her family background, her early education and decision to attend LSU, her sorority rush experience, social life on campus, her favorite teachers and classes, and Helen Gordon, Dean of Women.; Middleton recalls her role in building Chi Omega's house at LSU, and the role of women in the establishment of other sorority houses. She describes delays to the Chi Omega house's opening, furnishing the house, and her opinion of Greek organizations.
